Articles.Content:
Real Solar System doesn't work for me, so I'm going to make a Kopernicus version. As well, I've run out of ideas.

I'm going to have several versions - SolSystem Basic, Standard and Complete. I'm going to work on Basic first.

So, I've started development and firstly, I have a problem with Kopernicus. I'm texturing Mercury and when I texture the planet if I use ScaledVersion{} the planet disappears, and with VertexColorMap{} the planet is still pink. Here's the code... 

ScaledVersion
{
enabled = true
Material
{
texture = SolSystemBasic\Mercury_color.png
}
}
VertexColorMap
{
	map = SolSystemBasic\Mercury_color.png
	enabled = true
	order = 1
}

...and here's the log for the ScaledVersion one...

I'm not uploading the VertexColorMap{} because I'm not going to use it again and there was nothing indicating an issue.

I also want to change the colour of Sol to a bright yellow-white colour to make it more realistic. I should be OK making this.

Thankyou for helping,

JebKeb

5 hours ago, JebKeb said:

Real Solar System doesn't work for me, so I'm going to make a Kopernicus version

Something that might help is looking at the RSSKopernicus.cfg included in RSS. It has all the data necessary to create RSS in kopernicus...but then thats probably because RSS already uses kopernicus. So I'm not sure what this thread is actually about. It has used kopernicus since v10.0
Maybe it's just a kerbal scale version of the solar system? That would be cool.
The main differences I'm having inbetween RSS and this is that this will have MANY more bodies and everything's in orbit around a faraway star called Sol.
I'd like to know what's going wrong with the ScaledVersion{} because I'm going to use it for all my other Kopernicus mods.

Also, I'm don't seem to be able to find the entry interface altitude for Venus, Jupiter, Saturn, Titan, Uranus and Neptune.

for reference: Earth 120, mars 125
No one seems to like this idea, so I'm postponing the development of this mod.
Maybe you could do this as an expansion of RSS. The actual one works really well with all his related mods and it's pretty accurate. What is wrong in your opinion about RSS?

Nothing is wrong with RSS. I just can't use it because it doesn't work for me. So I wanted to make a Kopernicus-only version. I'm abandoning this project now, because I find it a bit boring. In a bit there'll be a more formal looking thread on another mod I'll be working on. 

Goodbye SolSystem.
